Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water and light.
Level Description: Advanced (complete and accurate representation of all elements)
CAN: The student can illustrate a plant with healthy leaves, showing that it receives adequate water and light.
The student can illustrate a plant with drooping or dry leaves, clearly representing a plant that lacks water.
The student can illustrate a plant with pale or wilted leaves, accurately representing a plant that lacks light.
The student can clearly illustrate the difference between a healthy plant and a struggling plant, effectively emphasizing the importance of water and light.
The student can include details that demonstrate patterns in how plants change when lacking water or light, such as consistent leaf coloration and structure changes.
CANNOT: The student might occasionally overlook minor details, such as labeling specific leaf conditions (e.g., not labeling wilted leaves as pale).
The student may not incorporate every possible pattern of plant change due to natural variation (e.g., might not draw roots visibly affected, as focus is on leaves).
